name: The Enchanted Tower [ALPHA]
description:
Poor Wilfred! His tower has been invaded by some annoying spirits. So, armed with courage and his little oil lamp, he shall drive them out of his home. And the only way to do it is by lighting all the cauldrons distributed in each of the floors that make up the tower, in order to give the eternal rest that all those evil spirits deserve.

But it will not be an easy task, since these lost souls are not willing to leave the earthly world, and have plagued the tower with traps, mechanisms and monsters, to prevent our nice (and hooded) hero from achieving his goal.

"The Haunted Tower" is a true tribute to the mythical Sinclair ZX Spectrum, in which I hope to capture (with more or less fidelity) the spirit that made that computer one of the most loved and remembered of all time.

MAIN FEATURES:

  • Attractive 1-bit ZX Spectrum style graphics.
  • Simple mechanics.
  • Control with one or two hands, you decide.
  • Lots of puzzles that will make you think about your next move.
  • Addictive and challenging game.

If the ZX Spectrum was your "playground", you can't miss this game.

 

CONTROLS:

  • WASD, Cursors or Sinclair (67890 keys) to move Wilfred.
  • P to pause game.
  • R to replay level.
  • J to switch Fullscreen.
  • K to switch Retro Effect/Scanlines.

.
